input_text:
Job Title: Marine Shipfitter

Location: Tampa, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Description

Tradesmen International is immediately hiring skilled Marine Shipfitters for projects located in and around Jacksonville, FL. This is a full time opportunity with a pay rate of up to $24/hour based on experience & skill level plus $110/per diem for travelers of 60+ miles from the job site . If you are a Marine Shipfitter and want to work alongside other proven craftsmen who emphasize safety, productivity and superior craftsmanship, this is your chance to advance your career!

Job Scope

Provide maritime ship fitting skills for repairs to ships & boats in the US Navy, US Coast Guard, Military Sealift Command, MSC, & Commercial VesselsLayout & measure utilizing both the imperial, English, & metric systemWork with hand tools & power toolsOperate and/or assist with overhead cranes to include safe rigging of components to be liftedUnderstand, interpret, & apply naval sea systems, Navsea milstd1689 and MIL STD 248DSet up, troubleshoot, & utilize welding machinesMeasure & remove steel and/or aluminum componentsFabricate and reinstall components at the gap tolerance for weldersDetermine proper equipment to be usedInspect tests & repairs, work pieces accordinglyTack welds, metal parts in placeConnect hoses from torch to tanks of oxygen and fuel/shielding gas & turn valves to release mixtureIgnite torch and regulate flow of gas and air to obtain desired temperature, size, & color of flameOther tasks as assigned

Requirements

2+ Years of ExperienceWeld Certificates from Technical School PreferredHS Diploma or Equivalent PreferredMust be able to pass a MIL STD 248D Certification TestWorking Knowledge of the Navsea Standard Items & Other Regulatory BodiesAbility to read blueprintsMust be proficient in Washing WeldAbility to work at heightsDBIDSDrug ScreenStandard PPEHand Tools

Company Details

Tradesmen International not only offers consistent work, top pay, and employment opportunities, we also provide a benefits package that is among the best in the industry.

Our Comprehensive Benefits Include

Tradesmen+ Rewards Program – earn points for hours workedVacation PayHealth insurance401(k) profit-sharing savings planIncentive programsTool purchase programs & MORE!

Tradesmen International is an EO employer - M/F/Veteran/Disability

Click here to visit Tradesmen’s full website. (http://www.tradesmeninternational.com)

Recruiter Name

Michelle Myers

Location

US-FL-TAMPA

Travel Yes

job_responsibilities: Provide maritime ship fitting skills for repairs
Layout & measure utilizing both the imperial, English, & metric system
Work with hand tools & power tools
Operate and/or assist with overhead cranes
Set up, troubleshoot, & utilize welding machines
Measure & remove steel and/or aluminum components
Fabricate and reinstall components at the gap tolerance for welders
Determine proper equipment to be used
Inspect tests & repairs, work pieces accordingly
Tack welds, metal parts in place
Connect hoses from torch to tanks of oxygen and fuel/shielding gas & turn valves to release mixture
Ignite torch and regulate flow of gas and air to obtain desired temperature, size, & color of flame
